newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU advertisers call talks with consumer groups.
newsitem.headline: EU advertisers call talks with consumer groups.

text.p: The world advertising industry has invited European consumer organisations to talks about their charges of covert and harmful advertising directed at children.
The invitation comes a month after the European consumer organisation BEUC demanded European Union legislation to clamp down on what it said was increasingly devious advertising aimed at children.
BEUC said children encountered advertising from morning to evening, whether at home, school or play, and that it was often so deviously presented that they did not recognise it as such.

The World Federation of Advertisers, which said it groups major national associations of advertisers and corporate advertisers throughout the world, announced on Tuesday it was ready to discuss the possibility of industry self-regulation with BEUC.
It said in a statement self-regulation rather than regulation should be the main agenda item.
But the WFA rejected the charges of covert and harmful advertising.
"There was nothing undesirable or hidden about companies using a wide range of communication media to engage the interest of children and parents," the organisation said.
It said the charges of covert advertising were based on a limited number of research studies.
